channel.title: Private Server Project (Hiring)
channel.description:
I'm looking to make a great private server with friendly mods and admins and a peaceful society (no peace in wildy ;)) I need server hosters, developers, admins, mods, designers, undercover mods, etc. Everything a good game needs to survive. Let me know if you want to try it out!
Server Name: GhostlyScape Staff: 12
[u]Developer[/u] - Mike (Ganaray)
[u]Administrators[/u] - Ben (Skux) - Marc (Icarus) - None
[u]Moderators[/u] - Jeremy (Mod Jermey) - Radet (Ryoken) - Steven.Tyler (W h i p e d) (Possibly More In Future)
[u]Undercover Mods[/u] - Why Would I Tell You Their Names? :)
[u]Server Hosters[/u] - Chris (Robin Hood)
[u]Designers[/u] - None - None - None
[u]Developers[/u] - Grey (Luvodicus) - Jake (Bacus) - None
[u]Forum Administrators[/u] - Mike (Ganaray) - None - None
Forum Moderators - None - None - None
[u]Game Testers[/u] - Ashton (Kashire) - Steven (BLOOD 1if3) - None
As you can see I want a very big server giving people the chance to try out everything and always have something new to play or use!
[u]Sign Up Form[/u] Name: Real Name (Game Name) Age: Please At Least Be A Teen... Dedication: Will You Dedicate Yourself To This Server? Job: What Job Do You Want? Do You Have Any Experience: Any Experience You Have. If No, Are You Willing To Learn: You Must Learn Or You Can Not Join! Will You Be Helpful and How: How Can You Benefit The Server?
Ok, let's make this the best server ever! Yahoo Email: ganaray336@yahoo.com Hotmail Email: ganaray336@hotmail.com (Please Use My Yahoo Email!)

item.title: Private Server Project (Hiring)
item.dc:creator: @Luvodicus Luvodicus
item.description:
@Luvodicus wrote:

Name: Grey (Luvodicus)

Age: 24

Dedication: Full dedication, pouring out endless amounts of personal sacrifice

Job: Coding Team Leader, Forums Admin

Do You Have Any Experience: I have experience organizing and delgating positions in projects. My personal coding abilities are limited to shop, npc, menus, messages, portals, and “minigame” type events. I’m experienced in “dungeon crawling” type scenarios, most of which aren’t used by many popular servers, and could add a sense of originality from the many PK servers…

Will You Be Helpful and How: (read below)

Servers usually fail for a variety of reasons:

  • The Owner/Hoster is only nterested in his/her own power and is hosting/owning the server simply to have the golden crown and admin status
  • The server is still the exact same source as when the owner/hoster downloaded the source, and rarely adds any updates
  • Updates are so few and far between, that even when updated, doesnt add any extra element to the game, merely a new option, or a new weapon.

As the Coding Team Leader, I would interact with the Owner/Admins, as well as listen to the players for suggestions on the games advances, and organize team settings to share these ideas and decide how we’d like to upgrade the server.
From there a plan would be created and organized, and specific assignments would be delegated to participating team members. The assignments, when completed, can be added to the server and compiled, finalizing the update in a quick, organized fashion.

With serveral team members working on the same update, but working on an individual assignment, Updates can be created, added, and imlpemented in a much more timely manner than that of one person trying to create new additions to game play on their own.

Coders would have a section on the forums, specifically for their use, where information and data can be shared, assignments can be delegated, and work orders can be stored/recieved.

Read full topic
